intro: Macaglia dasycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded macaglia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with a rough, hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
